Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Pending usually happens if the dealer node is backed up...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The only other thing that can happen, is if the dicebet tx was sent, but another dicebet is confirmed in a block, and the dicebet tx can get orphaned

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There likely needs to be some check added... To dice scripts, or GUI that tries to resend rawtransaction every few seconds. As once hte TX is invalidated by an incomoing block it will then fail to send, and the dAPP will know to create  a new one.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also the code that chooses utxo locally, isnt randomised and in real time, so you can create bad transactions with it espicially if you create them too quickly... there is some commented code in my commit you can uncomment to fix that, but it then allows nodes to spam contracts.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I can describe ways to speed up dealer node processing and details on how to block the 51% attack

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: those seem the last bottle neck here

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but I think we need to test some other contracts on a chain with the mempool fix and make sure it doesnt break them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, lets make sure things are stable now then we can speed it up and make it 51% secure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one easy way to speed up dealer node processing is as follows:

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: make 4 dealer nodes, dealer0, dealer1, dealer2, dealer3

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for each incoming tx, mask all but the last 2 bits of the bettxid and only process the one that matches the dealer nodeid

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just having a way to set dealer id, make sure you have all 4 running and then you get 4x capacity

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think your idea will be very useful for other contacts though, so it might be a good thing to work on next to keep learning about them. I wil have to write a contract at come point so I should get more experiance with them in any way possible.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: additionally, making it have more of an internal state machine control flow, with different queues for different states would get 10x or more capacity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: right now one node is queuing all dicebets to process

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then in the background processes them serially

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess that can just be made into multiple threads to make things go in parallel as long as the proper locks are done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: multithreaded dapp code is a bit tricky though

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there really isnt that much processing, most of it is waiting for it to appear in the mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so I would suggest breaking down the dealer node dicebet processing into as many different steps as possible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: making a queue of requests for each step

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: launching a thread to handle each queue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: do you have enough to implement the multiple queues approach?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes it is a bit beyond what you have done so far, but i think within reach

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea is to not have any sleeps

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is 100% of the time processing a new bet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: from what I remember the time from when it is broadcast to when it appears in the mempool was a bit slow and I had to add a sleep

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what you do instead of putting a sleep, is to put it into another queue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the first loop is done!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it can then keep up with a lot of dicebet coming in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then there is another thread that processes the other queue, what it does it iterate through the list and sees if it is done, if it is, it removes the entry and completes the processing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: probably a 10 millisecond sleep at the end of the queue before starting again to prevent eating up 100% of a core just looping over and over

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think the above will increase throughput immensely as it removes the sleep 1 entirely

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if 10 tx can be processed in a second it is 10x capacity increase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but 100+ can be done in a second
